class.name: lightweight_mutex
class.purpose: A header-only mutex which implements the Lockable concept of Boost.Thread.

description.para: The lightweight mutex class implements the Lockable concept of Boost.Thread, and is the default Mutex type for signals. If boost has detected thread support in the compiler's current translation mode, lightweight mutex will map to a CRITICAL_SECTION on Windows or a pthread_mutex on POSIX. If thread support is not detected, lightweight_mutex will behave similarly to a dummy_mutex. The header file boost/config.hpp defines the macro BOOST_HAS_THREADS when boost detects threading support. The user may globally disable thread support in boost by defining BOOST_DISABLE_THREADS before any boost header files are included.
If you are already using the Boost.Thread library, you may prefer to use its boost::mutex class as the mutex type for your signals.

You may wish to use a thread-unsafe signal in a multi-threaded program, if the signal is only used by a single thread. In that case, you may prefer to use the dummy_mutex class as the Mutex template type for your signal.
Makes a non-blocking attempt to lock the mutex.
